title: Citi's Rankings Soar in Extel Survey
summary: London - Citi underlined its position as a leading brokerage house and research provider as the bank was named among the highest-ranked firms in the 2013 Extel Pan-European Survey released on June 10.
tag-1: Citi's Rankings Soar in Extel Survey
tag-2: London – Citi underlined its position as a leading brokerage house and research provider as the bank was named among the highest-ranked firms in the 2013 Extel Pan-European Survey released on June 10.
tag-3: Citi was ranked No.1 provider in Economics & Strategy Research (up from third place in 2012) and No.1 in the Equity Sales category (up from third). The bank ranked No. 4 in the overall survey's results (up from fifth), second in the Emerging European Research category, third in the Best Brokerage Firm for Operations category and fifth in Equity Trading (up from ninth).
tag-4: Citi also captured 20 top-three and 28 top-five positions for country & sector research, a further demonstration of the bank's momentum in the space. Citi was recognized as the leading research provider for General Retail, Pharmaceuticals, Quant, U.K. small & mid cap companies, Valuation & Accounting as well as Financials, Telecoms and Chemicals in Emerging EMEA.
tag-5: The Thomson Reuters Extel Survey is regarded as a leading benchmark for excellence in investment banking and asset management. In 2013, it gathered 670,000 votes from more than 15,000 buy-side, brokerage and corporate professionals.
tag-6: Commenting on the survey's results, Andrew Thompson, Citi's Head of Equities in Europe, Middle- East and Africa (EMEA), said: "These results are a great recognition of the strength of Citi's global equity sales and trading force located in more than 29 cities across five continents. This extensive network, coupled with the investment themes developed by our top-ranked analysts, allow us to provide leading investment services and a powerful distribution platform to support and advise our clients to the highest standard in this volatile environment."
tag-7: Terence Sinclair, Citi's Head of Equity Research in EMEA, added, "Citi's top rankings across many of the Extel Survey's categories are a reflection of the bank's continued focus on its Research offering across a broad range of sectors and regions. Client satisfaction is the most important endorsement for us, and we are delighted that the quality of our business has been recognized in so many categories this year."
tag-8: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
